name: Clip DAT
description: License: Only available in TouchDesigner Pro.
summary: License: Only available in TouchDesigner Pro.

parameters.name: Edit..
parameters.label: Edit..
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
NOTE

License: Only available in TouchDesigner Pro.



The Clip  contains information about motion clips that are manipulated by a Clip CHOP and Clip Blender CHOP.		
The Clip  can hold any command or script text, which can be triggered based on the settings on the  parameter page (This is where the Clip  and the Text  are different). The Clip 's script is triggered by specified clips being played through a Clip Blender CHOP.
clipDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  edit - Clicking this opens a text editor to add/edit/delete text from the .


		
  file - The path and name of the file to load. Accepts .txt and .dat files. The file can be read in from disk or from the web. Use http:// when specifying a URL.


		
  reload - When set to 1, reloads the file into the .





  executeloc -  - Determines the location the script is run from.

 current - The script is executed from the current node location. here - The script is executed from the Text  itself. comp - The script is executed from the component specified in the  parameter below.
		
  clip - Points to the Clip CHOP which will trigger the script when run in a Clip Blender CHOP.


		
  component - The path that the script will be executed from if the Execute From parameter is set to Specified .


		
  framefirst - Executes the script once, the first time the specified index of the clip is played in a clipblender. Even if the clip is looping in a clipblender, the script will only be executed once.


		
  frameloop - Executes the script everytime the specified index of the clip is played in a clipblender. When a clip is looping, the script will run each time through the loop.


		
  exit - Executes the script when a clipblender exits the specified clip.


		
  printstate - Print debug information to the textport.





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. language - pick extension from DATs script language. custom - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.



Extra Information for the Clip  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Number of rows in this . - Number of columns in this .
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2022.241402021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.



An Operator Family that contains its own Network. There are sixteen 3D Object Component and ten 2D Panel Component types. See also Network Path.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Clip_DAT&oldid=24316"
		Category: DATs
